result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha Jo LHuillier

defendant.name: LHuillier, Samantha Jo
defendant.address: 4800 W. Greenfield Avenue, Apt 11, Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with Silverspot Cinema, unless she is an employee who works at that location listed in the Criminal Complaint.

10:20 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Samantha Jo LHuillier in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. The Defendant states she is retaining attorney Winters.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
The Defendant waives the preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

The Court recalls the matter at 10:53 AM with the same appearances.
The Defendant states she does currently work at Sliverspot Cinema.
The State does not object to amending the bond.
The Court amends the bond.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
